Wisdom: مَنْ كَانَتْ لَهُ فِكْرَةٌ فَلَهُ فِي كُلِّ شَيْ‏ءٍ عِبْرَةٌ
enWisdom: One who thinks and reflects learns a lesson from everything
For the sagacious person there is admonition in everything
Time shows you examples
In time there are vicissitudes (or lessons [to be learnt])
The most effective admonition is taking a lesson from the place where the dead lay
Stay near (or pass by) the graves and you will learn a lesson

Wisdom: اتَّعِظُوا مِمَّنْ كَانَ قَبْلَكُمْ قَبْلَ أَنْ يَتَّعِظَ بِكُمْ‏ مَنْ بَعْدَكُمْ
enWisdom: Take lessons from [the lives of] those who preceded you before those who are after you take lessons from you
Verily for those who remain [behind] there is an example in those who have passed
Verily for the latter there is an admonishment in the former

Wisdom: خُلِّفَ لَكُمْ عِبَرٌ مِنْ آثَارِ الْمَاضِينَ قَبْلَكُمْ لِتَعْتَبِرُوا بِهَا
enWisdom: You have been left with examples from the vestiges of those who passed away before you, so take lesson from them

Wisdom: إِنَّ فِي كُلِّ شَيْ‏ءٍ مَوْعِظَةً وَعِبْرَةً لِذَوِي اللُّبِّ وَالِاعْتِبَارِ
enWisdom: Verily there is a lesson and an admonition in everything for the people of wisdom and understanding

Wisdom: إِنَّ الْأُمُورَ إِذَا تَشَابَهَتْ اعْتُبِرَ آخِرُهَا بِأَوَّلِهَا
enWisdom: Indeed when matters are similar, the latter is judged by the former
In the vicissitudes of this world there are lessons to be learnt
In every glance there is a lesson

Wisdom: فِي تَصَارِيفِ الْقَضَاءِ عِبْرَةٌ لِأُولِي الْأَلْبَابِ وَالنُّهَى
enWisdom: In the changes brought about by divine decree there is a lesson for the people of reason and intellect
In the succession of days there is lesson for the creatures

Wisdom: فِطْنَةُ الْمَوَاعِظِ تَدْعُو إِلَى الْحَذَرِ فَاتَّعِظُوا بِالْعِبَرِ وَاعْتَبِرُوا بِالْغِيَرِ وَانْتَفِعُوا بِالنُّذُرِ
enWisdom: Comprehension [and acceptance] of admonitions invites one to caution, so take admonition from the examples [of the past], and take lesson from the [sudden] changes in circumstances, and take benefit from the Warners

Wisdom: قَدِ اعْتَبَرَ بِالْبَاقِي مَنِ اعْتَبَرَ بِالْمَاضِي
enWisdom: He who takes a lesson from the past [that has gone] has taken a lesson for the remaining [future]

Wisdom: كُلُّ يَوْمٍ يُفِيدُكَ عِبَراً إِنْ أَصْحَبْتَهُ فِكْراً
enWisdom: Every day benefits you with lessons if you accompany it with contemplation

Wisdom: كَفَى مُعْتَبَراً لِأُولِي النُّهَى مَا عَرَفُوا
enWisdom: For the people of intelligence, what they are aware of is enough of a lesson for them
How many the lessons are, and how few of them are learnt!
